methods.javadoc:
Flushes the given program's events before waiting for the swing update manager
@param program The program whose events will be flushed; may be null
methods.name: waitForProgram
methods.comment: Flushes the given program's events before waiting for the swing update manager

params.name: program
params.comment: The program whose events will be flushed; may be null

methods.name: addPlugin
methods.comment:
Adds the given plugin to the tool and then returns the instance of the plugin that was
 added

params.name: c
params.comment: the class of the plugin to add

throws.comment:
if the plugin could not be constructed, or there was problem 
 		   executing its init() method, or if a plugin of this class already exists in the tool

methods.name: getAction
methods.comment:
Finds the action by the given owner name and action name.  
 If you do not know the owner name, then use  
 the call #getActions(DockingTool, String) instead.
 
 Note: more specific test case subclasses provide other methods for finding actions 
 when you have an owner name (which is usually the plugin name).

params.name: tool
params.comment: the tool containing all system actions

return.comment: the matching action; null if no matching action can be found

methods.name: showDialogWithoutBlocking
methods.comment:
Shows the given DialogComponentProvider using the given tool's 
 PluginTool#showDialog(DialogComponentProvider) method.  After calling show on a 
 new thread the method will then wait for the dialog to be shown by calling
 TestEnv#waitForDialogComponent(Window, Class, int).

params.name: tool
params.comment: The tool used to show the given provider.

return.comment:
The provider once it has been shown, or null if the provider is not shown within
         the given maximum wait time.

methods.name: waitForBusyTool
methods.comment: Waits for the tool to finish executing commands and tasks

methods.name: saveTool
methods.comment:
Save the given tool to the project tool chest.  If the tool already exists, then it will
 be overwritten with the given tool.

params.name: project
params.comment: The project which with the tool is associated.

methods.name: click
methods.comment:
Triggers a browser click at the current cursor location.  Thus, this method should be 
 called only after the browser location is set the the desired field.
